website_summaries.verdict: Sturdy exercise station offers exercises for the entire body, including abs. Middle-of-the-road price point makes it perfect for serious fitness buffs.
pros: Use for dips, push-ups, pull-ups, knee raises, and other ab exercises
cons: Arm pads may tear after use, and unit may rock during certain exercises, requiring additional stabilization

customer_reviews.title: Other than that I really like the product
customer_reviews.text: Materials are very solid, doesn't wobble as similar products might. Took maybe 30 minutes to assemble by myself. Only had one bolt give me trouble threading into the cushioned back suooort, but I eventually got it to go in. Only complaint is that the arms are too close together and when doing leg raises it brush the arm pads. Just doing a simple straight leg raise directly in the middle and I still either barely miss the pad or it brushes my leg each time. Other than that I really like the product, no wobbling here!
customer_reviews.author: Adam C.

customer_reviews.title: Solid and easy to assemble, but has foul odor
customer_reviews.text: This appears to be a solid knee raise station - definitely more robust than I expected. It is also larger than I expected (the measurements provided are accurate, I just failed to properly visualize it in the space). Assembly was straight forward. My major gripe about this unit is the odor that emanates from the grips. It is possible this is only an issue with the unit I received but figure it is worth mentioning. It smells like burned rubber mixed with formaldehyde or something to that effect - very "chemically." I ended up removing the grips entirely and scrubbing the inside of the tubes to get rid of the smell (this worked).
customer_reviews.author: Neil Sabol

customer_reviews.title: Decent VKR for the price
customer_reviews.text: This unit is pretty well made. It went together easily, everything lined up and all of the correct parts were in the box. My only complaint is that the unit is not adjustable for people with long arms. I am 6'4", 230lbs, with 27" sleeve length. I will need to modify the hand grips or move the back pad farther back to make the unit work for me. As it is, it's too cramped and I cannot straighten my arms out to grip the handles. The unit flexes a little when doing dips. Great vkr for a normal sized person, but not perfect for taller/heavier people.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Exercise Equipment
customer_reviews.text: Well built and sturdy. This is a good rack, way better that the Joe Weider options. I’ve had both, the Xmark is by far better quality. I would’ve given 5 stars, but the lower support bar sits a little too high and hits the back of my feet and ankles in the downward part of the knee raise. Other than that, it’s what I was looking for
customer_reviews.author: Julianna G.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Solid
customer_reviews.text: I keep this in my basement and use it about once a week. It's very sturdy and well built. The pads are thick and comfortable, and the padded bar at the bottom is perfect for sit-ups. Protip: Do not tighten any of the bolts until you finish building it and stand on the legs to level it! A couple other reviewers mentioned this and it's good advice if you want it to sit flat on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewed by John

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of equipment after I fixed the problem
customer_reviews.text: One of the bolt holes were not drilled. Had to drill it to finish assembly. When opening the box, there is a big tag that says "STOP. Have an issue? Before returning or leaving feedback" call or email. I emailed, but nobody emailed back. I would probably still buy their brand because it's solid. Their customer service isn't great, so don't expect a lot there.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Livingston

customer_reviews.title: quality product
customer_reviews.text: superior to all other towers. no pull up bar is a plus with low ceilings and moving. after assembly you could easily unbolt it into two halves to make moving it easier. or keep it together and it's still easy to move. this is the most sturdy tower I've used as of yet.
customer_reviews.author: Church

customer_reviews.title: It's a pretty reasonable value
customer_reviews.text: I actually purchased this piece for my CrossFit gym. While not as substantial as a true commercial piece, it meets the needs of a smaller club population. It's a pretty reasonable value, although given we had to assemble it ourselves,which took a couple hours, that in itself should have reduced the cost. It;s still new, so we'll see over time how wear and tear impacts it, but I think it should last awhile and it's certainly durable enugh for a homeowner or a similar small population commercial studio.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Schwab

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: All in all I'm happy with the product- was easy to assemble and very sturdy. The arms are a little too padded, to the point where I sink down more than I would like to. I also wish that the arms were adjustable- being a short female, I have to slide my arms out farther to grab the handles, and that also accounts for me sink down farther, which throws my posture off but I'll just have to work around it.
customer_reviews.author: Heather G

customer_reviews.title: Excellent piece of Equipment
customer_reviews.text: We looked at a number of these on-line and in stores. This version was slightly more expensive than than the lowest price on-line products, but less than the ones you see in fitness stores by at least $100. But it is a very sturdy piece of equipment and well made. I'm 6'1 and 240 but there is plenty of room for me to use the tower without being cramped. Definitely recommend this if you are looking for a tower.
customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the fitness room!
customer_reviews.text: I would strongly recommend this product to people who are looking for alternative ways to work on your core and your arms. This combination unit is great for focus on tri's, abs and pecs. My whole family uses this piece of equipment and it's a quick add to the exercise cycle. Relatively easy to set up - completed within an hour. The directions were clear. The one thing that would have made set up easier would have been a wrench included in the package. Very sturdy unit and well worth the price! Enjoy -
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Fortier

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.text: A sturdy m, stable piece of equipment that fits nicely in our exercise room.
customer_reviews.author: Amsquare

customer_reviews.title: Not bad. It's not quite as attractive as some of ...
customer_reviews.text: Not bad. It's not quite as attractive as some of the others but it's strong and fairly well designed. Doesn't take long to assemble, even for just one person. However when you bolt it together you may not be able to tighten every bolt completely without ending up with a slight wobble. I tried several times but could never get it to stand completely flat without loosening a couple of brace bolts slightly. I don't think it's a problem though since you're working with locknuts. Overall I think it's definitely worth the money. You should see my abs :)
customer_reviews.author: Henry Teixeira

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, just what i need
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to assemble; takes about an hour. Make sure you don't fully tighten until you have it all together. Very sturdy. I'm 5 11, 180 and it doesn't budge when I'm doing dips are leg raises. This is the second Xmark product I've purchased and they have both been top quality.
customer_reviews.author: J Cissell

customer_reviews.title: really sturdy, well constructed
customer_reviews.text: Well, got this machine, assembled it in about 30 minutes, really sturdy, well constructed, only thing is I found out, I am having shoulder surgery, and could not rest my body weight on supports because of that, other than my own issues, no complaints here.
customer_reviews.author: bugman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product Very solidly built and sturdy. Easy to assemble. Arrived a lot sooner than estimated Great piece of exercise equipment. Good for abs, arms, legs. Really enhances a workout.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: It is sturdy and feels solid when working out. Insure u have at least an 8 foot ceiling because it is tall. From top of the back rest to the floor is about 6 feet.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: Strudy
customer_reviews.text: We have had one of these before and it took up soo much space. This one was really easy to assemble and it's compact. Very sturdy and does the job. Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: tiffany ribeira

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Loved the quality, just have to hire someone to use it
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Built rugged and tall enough for me at 6'4"!! Massive ab workout!
customer_reviews.author: W. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Good work out
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, great for leg raises, relatively easy to put together. part of my daily work out
customer_reviews.author: Bisonte

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not for commercial use. Arm pad were completely ...
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not for commercial use. Arm pad were completely both torn after only 45 days of use. Does anyone know where to get replacement arm pads for this?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy frame
customer_reviews.text: This thing works like it should. The only issue is the last two bolts didn't quote fit in the holes on the angle supports. (and yes I only hand tightened everything like you should) I had some 3/8" hitch pins laying around that did the job though. Very sturdy and quality made though.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Luneack

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: The reviews speak for themselves. Received the package a day before they told me (3 days as a prime member). Initially opened up the box and thought this does not look like fun putting it together at all! Took me about an hour and fifteen minutes without a ratchet that fit the bolts. So could be less depending on your tools. You do need something to hold the opposite end bolts to tighten which I had. I used it as soon as I was finished and because i had it on carpet it wobbled slightly but if it was on hard floor it would be fine. Overall seems like a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Melillo

customer_reviews.title: Tank
customer_reviews.text: The best. So strong. Built well. Easy to put together
customer_reviews.author: Patriotic purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Excellant built equipment
customer_reviews.text: Very well built piece of equipment. Not difficult to assemble even though metric wrenches make it easier. I phoned the manufacturer and found that it had a 350 lb. capacity. I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene D. Carey, Jr

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money !!!! Sturdy !!!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for very sturdy fairly easy to put together within 20-30 minutes, just what I needed ! Nice
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dnice
customer_reviews.text: this is a great piece of equipment very easy to assemble does not take up alot of space and I definitely recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Derrick C. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Well built, easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Well built, easy to assemble, very happy with purchase, fast shipping.
customer_reviews.author: twomc

customer_reviews.title: Great VKR
customer_reviews.text: Solid piece of equipment, no issues and I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Cem

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as commercial grade!!
customer_reviews.text: Ok I went round and round with the idea that this piece of equipment must be commercial grade gym quality and the XMark delivered. Trust me this thing is solid. Some other reviews say it's wobbly and uneven but mine is not. It's very rigid and just as good as the one piece 700$ ones. Save your money and get this!!! Only one negative thing I found just to keep it real are the elbow pads. I wish they were not so soft. I find my elbows digging in a bit. I just adjust a bit and I'm fine but I might suggest a little thicker pad to the company but I'm still giving this piece of equipment 5 stars!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rudy A. Leuver Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Big but sturdy!!
customer_reviews.text: Helps to relieve back pain by building up core muscles. Price was well worth the quality of this fine product.
customer_reviews.author: Will D. Booker

customer_reviews.title: Nice piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: Very solid and sturdy with 240lb on it The fat grips are comfortable The end caps on the foot pads are made out of plastic and keep coming off. Nice piece of equipment that does what its suppose to do very well
customer_reviews.author: Kevin L Cox

customer_reviews.title: Great Piece
customer_reviews.text: I love this piece of equipment. It is solidly built and feels capable of getting the job done. Good Piece for what I was expecting. However, I was not satisfied with the condition the equipped was delivered in. The box was torn to just about pieces. But all the pieces where in the box in good condition. I recommend this piece highly.
customer_reviews.author: Professor

customer_reviews.title: Very solid
customer_reviews.text: Very solid and sturdy piece of equipment. Pads are soft and comfortable. The bars are not too far apart allowing smaller individuals to use comfortably. Simple to assemble. Don't tighten until in place.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Young

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction. Went together easy. 4 available workouts make this very versatile to use. This also takes up very little space for the workout you get. Added this to a whole gym collection
customer_reviews.author: Corey Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent addition to a home gym
customer_reviews.text: Excellent addition to a home gym. Very solidly built and easy to assemble. You get what you pay for and this is a solid, heavy duty home gym piece. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: wow
customer_reviews.text: i never thought u could find a machine that really works ur cor without it taking up to much space, very durable and easy to assemble, if you have a home gym beats from paying 30.00$ a month membership fees, this product pays for itself,on the other hand u may just need someone to stand on before u tighten all the bolt to make sure all bolts sit. good luck hope this helps
customer_reviews.author: gerardo Berumen

customer_reviews.title: easy to put together by one person
customer_reviews.text: As described. easy to put together by one person, rock solid for 200lb user.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Abs still hurt!
customer_reviews.text: Love this piece of equipment!! I've used it a few times and it works great! Very easy to put together. The most time consuming part was tightening the bolts after the entire unit was assembled. Nothing seems generic right down to the padding. The unit is in my basement where I have high ceilings. If you do not have high ceilings in basement and you are over 6'2" doing dips could get interesting! Would highly recommend to anyone looking to get a good workout.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Mazanowski

customer_reviews.title: dip station
customer_reviews.text: I love this for the knee raises. I really enjoy using this equipment. Seems sturdy and took about an hr to put together. Nice if you could have another pair of hands to help put it together though.
customer_reviews.author: james trivette

product_meta.title: XMark Vertical Knee Raise with Dip Station XM-4437.1
product_meta.description: The XMark Vertical Knee Raise with Dip Station will provide defined abs, stronger arms, a well-developed chest, and a strong back. While the vertical knee raise station targets your core and abs the push-up station focuses on your chest. Twin dip handles are ergonomically spaced to help give a great dip workout to strengthen arms and shoulders. Simple, basic, rugged and, most of all, effective, the XM-4437 vertical knee raise enables an impressive list of exercises packed into one product. Sculpt, build and define your body with XMark, the mark of excellence.
feature_bullets: Vertical knee raise, dip and push-up stations
Dip and push-up handles with rubber grips
14-gauge steel mainframe construction with scratch resistant powder coat finish
Extra thick 2.5-inch high-density cushion and double stitched, tear-resistant Duraguard vinyl
Tough skid resistant feet helps protect your floors against damage

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
